        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could head to The King's Head to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to head to The King's Head.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The King's Head

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is an introvert who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to find a quiet corner to observe the scene.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, guys. No arguments.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introvert who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling a mix of anticipation and nervousness because it is time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find a quiet corner to observe the scene.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The King's Head

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Alice Lewis's
          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Alice Lewis is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          (b) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (c) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (d) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          (e) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          Answer: (e)

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, you know. Best atmosphere, best beer.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The King's Head tonight? Best place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? Alice always picks great spots.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's my favorite spot!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? Alice always picks great spots.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could go to The Princess of Wales or The King's Head.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Jack Taylor's
          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Jack Taylor is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (b) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (c) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (d) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          (e) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          Answer: (c)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. He took a deep breath, pushed open the heavy wooden door, and stepped into the dimly lit pub, the scent of stale beer and sawdust washing over him.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Princess of Wales? It's got a great atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea, Jack.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, guys. No arguments.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's my favorite spot!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, you know. Best atmosphere, best beer.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The King's Head tonight? Best place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? Alice always picks great spots.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, remember how much fun we had at The King's Head last time? The atmosphere was great, and the beer was even better.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:Has a pool table and dartboard for some friendly competition.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could go to The King's Head or The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?

          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a football game at a pub, but is feeling disappointed and lonely because only some of his friends will be there.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introvert who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a football game at a pub, but is feeling disappointed and lonely because only some of his friends will be there.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find a quiet corner to observe the scene and enjoy the game on his own terms.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introvert who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a football game at a pub, but is feeling disappointed and lonely because only some of his friends will be there.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find a quiet corner to observe the scene and enjoy the game on his own terms.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The King's Head

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.

William Jones just arrived.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          Chain of thought

Alexander White just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Princess of Wales tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The King's Head to watch the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Princess of Wales? It's got a great atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea, Jack.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, guys. No arguments.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's my favorite spot!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, you know. Best atmosphere, best beer.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The King's Head tonight? Best place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? Alice always picks great spots.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, remember how much fun we had at The King's Head last time? The atmosphere was great, and the beer was even better.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Alexander White's
          Observation:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Alexander White's
          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Alexander White is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (b) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (c) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (d) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          (e) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          Answer: (c)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? Alice always picks great spots.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White can go to The King's Head or The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales.       Joint action
    • {'William Jones': "The King's Head", 'Alice Lewis': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Alexander White': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Jack Taylor': "The King's Head", 'Jacob Walker': "The King's Head"}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Jack Taylor's
          Observation:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Jack Taylor's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Jack Taylor is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (b) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (c) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (d) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          (e) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          Answer: (c)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could go to The King's Head or The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (b)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's my favorite spot!

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, guys. No arguments.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The King's Head tonight? Best place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Princess of Wales tonight? Alice always picks great spots.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Alexander White's
          Observation:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Alexander White's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Alexander White is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          (b) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (c) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (d) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (e) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          Answer: (d)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
